results.title: Media: massaging the mind (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patrick Corbett, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Hobel-Leiterman Productions
results.brief_description: Analysis (from a 1970’s point of view) of the future directions of American mass media, Industry people argue for specialised anchors, print journalism, vertical programming and electronic imaging - to name but a few - as the direction for the future. However, such directions are not always considered favourable. Also looks at the role of politics, youth and community in media.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Corbett, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Hobel-Leiterman Productions

results.title: Media school
results.brief_description: A report on a course in communications with a group of 16 year-old boys from Melbourne High School. The media school is residential and the experiences range through music, mass media and personal relationships. An important featujre is the free open approachto life in general. Made as a segment for the ABC’s “This Day Tonight” program.

results.title: Mechanised batter stabilzation
results.brief_description: When roads, waterways and railways are made through a cutting, erosion occurs on the banks or batters. The subsoil having been largely removed, grass or other plants will not easily grow. Mechanised equipment is now used to stabilise these batters. First the eroded gullies are eliminated, then a mixture of bitumen and straw mulch applied and finally water, seed and fertilizer sprayed on. The bitumen stabilises the soil, the straw mulch protects the seedlings and pasture regeneration is no longer a problem.

results.title: Mechanical handling of traffic
results.creator_credit: British Railways and Southern Region Film Unit
results.brief_description: Mechanical aids to handling increasing amounts of goods and parcels leading to faster freight services on British Railways. Shows in some detail the various mechanical aids which speed up handling safety and efficiency in sheds, yards and stations.

results.title: Matt Mann's swimming techniques for girls
results.brief_description: A demonstration of Matt Mann’s teaching principles applied to a group of girls. The crawl, breast stroke, back stroke, and butterfly stroke are demonstrated in both regular and slow motion photography.

results.title: Mathematics of the honeycomb
results.creator_credit: Moody Institute of Science. Educational Film Division
results.brief_description: Explains the place of mathematics in engineering and the sciences as evidenced by the application of modern mathematical methods to the honeycomb problem. Includes close-up scenes of bees exuding and manipulating wax.

results.title: Maternal deprivation in young children
results.creator_credit: Genevieve Appell, Institut National d'Hygiene and New York University. Film Library
results.brief_description: Part of the record collected by a French research unit studying the effects of mernal deprivation in young children. Those studied are between one and two-and-a-half years old. All had been reared in institutions where because of impersonal care they had become seriously impaired in the capacity for human relationship. The film shows the disorders that appear and the subsequent progress of the children under psychotherapy. A study carried out by a French research unit directed by Jenny Rondinesco.

results.title: Mass radiography
results.creator_credit: S.O. Siecki, H.M. Nieter and Seven League Unit
results.brief_description: By means of mobile X-Ray units it is possible to take radiograms of large numbers of people I a relatively short time. These photographs are then examined by expert radiologists, and diagnoses made. In this film, the visit of a mobile X-Ray unit to a British factory is shown. (The film is intended for use by Medical Officers and Health and Welfare Officers when they are planning to send a mobile X-Ray unit to a place not previously visited). Also made for the prevention of tuberculosis. Narrated by Lionel Gamlin.
